title: Can somebody lend me a hand of Help

forumNotes.author: Saad Gilani
forumNotes.content: I am having a 512MB flash disk which has gone corrupt. when I plug it in my computer it is detected as 512 MB removable disk but with no data. neither it is getting formatted nor being read. Now I am in a state of fix can somebody help.

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content: Try the following: * Open up a command prompt (**cmd.exe**) * In there, type **set devmgr_show_nonpresent_devices=1** * Unplug your USB stick * Type in **devmgmt.msc** * **Device Manager** will open. Choose **View** -\> **Show hidden devices** * Find the USB stick under **Disk drives** . Right-click it and choose **Uninstall** * Look under **Storage volumes** . For each "phantom" (greyed-out) storage volume, right-click it and choose **Uninstall**

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> No sir all efforts failed. It says CRC error now what to do how can I rectify this error
What happens, i.e. what is the output (VID \& PID) of running ChipGenius?  
What make/model/brand is the stick?  

![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Saad Gilani
forumNotes.content:
Chip Genius says following  

Device Name: ++\[J:\]\[H:\]+USB Input Device(Multi Flash Reader USB Device)(Kingston DataTraveler...  

PnP Device ID: VID = 15D9 PID = 0A4C  
Serial Number: 5\&\&DFD8F09\&\&0\&\&2  
Revision: 1.00/1.00  

Device Type: Standard USB device - USB2.0 High-Speed  

Chip Vendor: (No match record)  
Chip Part-Number: (No match record)  

Product Vendor: Multi  
Product Model: Flash Reader  

Tools on Web: (N/A)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
:smile:  
I have some perplexities about the "originality" of that stick as a "Kingston", which normally uses VID 0951 or   
That VID/PID of 15D9/0A4C has been reported as using a SKYMEDI chipset but also as been used by a mouse ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png)  
As well as actually a Kingston DataTraveler G2:  
[http://translate.goo...Ft65506_15.html](http://translate.google.it/translate?hl=it&sl=zh-CN&tl=en&u=http%3A%2F%2Fbbs.mydigit.cn%2Fsimple%2F%3Ft65506_15.html "External link")  

Anyway Kingston sticks either use a SKY or a PHISON chip.  

You can try using the manufacturer tool utilities:  
Skymedi:  
[http://flashboot.ru/...s-file-217.html](http://flashboot.ru/Files-file-217.html "External link")  

Phison:  
[http://flashboot.ru/...s-file-435.html](http://flashboot.ru/Files-file-435.html "External link")  
[http://flashboot.ru/...s-file-431.html](http://flashboot.ru/Files-file-431.html "External link")  

![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png)  
Wonko
